title: Adrián Slančík
text:
Adrián Slančík (born 22 July 1999) is a <a href="Slovakia">Slovak</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> goalkeeper who currently plays for <a href="FK%20Pohronie">FK Pohronie</a>, competing in the <a href="Slovak%20Super%20Liga">Fortuna Liga</a>, as a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
Club career.
1. FC Tatran Prešov.
Slančík made his <a href="Slovak%20First%20Football%20League">Fortuna Liga</a> debut for <a href="1.%20FC%20Tatran%20Pre%C5%A1ov">Tatran Prešov</a> at <a href="%C5%A0tadi%C3%B3n%20Pasienky">Pasienky</a> against <a href="%C5%A0K%20Slovan%20Bratislava">Slovan Bratislava</a> on 22 October 2017. Despite being the underdogs in the match, Tatran only lost by a single goal - 2:3. Slančík conceded a goal from Hungarian international <a href="D%C3%A1vid%20Holman">Dávid Holman</a> and two more from Czech top scorer of Slovan <a href="Jakub%20Mare%C5%A1">Jakub Mareš</a>.
FK Pohronie.
After match-less spells in the top division at <a href="FC%20DAC%201904%20Dunajsk%C3%A1%20Streda">DAC</a> and <a href="FK%20Senica">Senica</a>, in the summer of 2021, Slančík returned to native central Slovakia to a town of <a href="%C5%BDiar%20nad%20Hronom">Žiar nad Hronom</a>, where he signed with <a href="FK%20Pohronie">Pohronie</a>. While he remained benched in the first round fixture of the <a href="2021%E2%80%9322%20Slovak%20First%20Football%20League">new season</a> at <a href="%C5%A0tadi%C3%B3n%20Antona%20Malatinsk%C3%A9ho">Štadión Antona Malatinského</a> against <a href="FC%20Spartak%20Trnava">Spartak Trnava</a>, due to an illness of the preferred goalkeeper <a href="Libor%20Hrdli%C4%8Dka">Libor Hrdlička</a>, Slančík had debuted in the second matchday on 31 July 2021. Pohronie won the <a href="Mestsk%C3%BD%20%C5%A1tadi%C3%B3n%20%C5%BDiar%20nad%20Hronom">home</a> fixture against <a href="MFK%20Zempl%C3%ADn%20Michalovce">Zemplín Michalovce</a> 2:0, via two first half goals by <a href="Ladji%20Mall%C3%A9">Ladji Mallé</a> and <a href="Milo%C5%A1%20La%C4%8Dn%C3%BD">Miloš Lačný</a>. After the match, he described the match as difficult, applauding the field players for two early strikes and solid defensive work, while highlighting the need to improve the performance.
